Kup:

It was a long time since he had been watting in Lord Elder's Base, an=
d it was tiem to take action in this matter, his best friends were in Hdyra=
s hands and it was time take measure in that.

"Lord Elder... this is Kup"S=
aid the old maximal "What't the situation?"


From: Sandy 
Sent: Wednesday,=
 March 03, 2010 10:16 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Back to t=
he Ark


  
Rat Trap could not let go of the fact that Rodimus may not have=
 turned sides on purpose. Yet he speaks no more of him around Lord Elder. T=
ucson senses it in Rat Trap's quiet grunt. Lord Elder made sense to him. Ri=
ght now, he did not need to bad mouth Rodimus for what happened to him, he =
had to try to UNDERSTAND what happened and try to figure out a way to help =
him and try to put the past behind him once he did help him. 

"Rat Trap, I=
 don't want to sound like a demon's advocate here, but, Lord Elder is right=
. I don't think Rodimus really intended to turn sides like he did, and perh=
aps the force that got him there was far greater than he could fend off. We=
 really shouldn't jump to conclusions."

Quickstride listens in as well.

"=
 Good point. We really should listen ta Tucson, Rat Trap, and Lord Elder."
=

Rat Trap sighs.

"Okay, I promise not one more bad word outa my mouth abou=
t anyone.. Except for the Preds and Decepticons. Now about that minion... I=
 almost forgot about that one Lord Elder.. Gee, bad me, forgot ta put my to=
ys away when I was done playn' with 'em.."

Tucson struggles to get on his =
feet, and walks over to Lord Elder.

" I've got an idea Lord Elder... It wo=
rked at that Fortress, so it might work here.. My sonar transmitter.. If we=
 can augment the frequency from my transmitter through the audio systems of=
 this ship, we may just be able to stun that minion and any others that are=
 around the Maximal base. Of course, being careful to program the frequency=
 so it doesn't harm Maximals or Autobots... Let's see... I've done somethin=
g to that effect before... I'll do a very mild form of the sonar transmissi=
on, and let me know if any of you feel it."

He performs a test which prove=
s harmless to Maximal kind. Rat Trap shakes his head no as well as Quickstr=
ide.

"Good, you can't feel the effects. I do believe this frequency may ju=
st be able to do something mild to a Predacon and a Decepticon. I don't nee=
d to amp it by much, just enough to stun them, and hopefully get some stasi=
s cuffs on them before they move. I have several pairs left on hand, just e=
nough to capture a few more minions. Good thing this has its own battery."
=

Quickstride prepares several of his energy weapons for use.

"Looks like w=
e're tak'n a little detour."

Something in Tucson's directory snaps. He rai=
ses a brow in alarm. Thoughts race through his mind and one suddenly hits h=
im.

"Wait a minute.. Lord Elder, the attack on the base.... Why would they=
 want an old base when there's more to be had at the Ark? Of course... A DI=
VERSION! THEY'RE PLANNING A DIVERSION SO THEY CAN GET US AWAY FROM THE ARK!=
" 

He looks to Lord Elder in alarm.

"Sorry for raising my voice, that was=
n't my intent, but the Ark is in grave danger and even with the shields, on=
ce the power is drained the shields will not function any more. They know t=
hat Lord Elder. They know that with an attack at the old Maximal Base, they=
 can draw attention off the Ark and toward the base. It leaves it completel=
y vulnerable to attack."

Rat Trap and Quickstride look to each other and t=
hen back to Lord Elder and Tucson.

"So, what do we do Wheels?"

Tucson sig=
hs.

"There's four of us here. Two of us go back to the Ark, and two of us =
continue to the Maximal base. Of course, with Lord Elders permission. It's =
the only way we can secure both locations at one time."
--- In nbwrpg@yahoo=
groups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > " I - promise =
Lord Elder. Not one thing - will be touched in the ark. In honor of those I=
 serve, I will - not upset any balance that still remains in place."
> 
> "=
That is good Tuscon." Lord Elder said as he struggled to keep the
> shuttle=
 in flight. It was getting a little easier as he got used to
> the imbalanc=
e of one of the engines.
> 
> > "Actually, there is a name that fits ya bet=
ter. What'dya think about TUCSON PRIME?"
> >
> > Quickstride gives Rat Trap=
 a thumbs up.
> >
> > " Works for me, what'dya think Lord Elder?"
> 
> Lord=
 Elder is silent for a moment, "The Primes are a special breed."
> he said =
finally, the look on his face grave. "They are chosen by the
> matrix, the =
name shouldn't be just given."
> 
> > " I sure know that one Wheels. Primus=
 knows we've all been there in some point in our lives. But I got a feeln' =
that I don't normally get.. I ain't usually too optimistic but there's a ti=
ny little feeling of optimism startn' ta build in me. Don't usually get thi=
s warm'n fuzzy but it's there. And it started when I first saw ya in that f=
ortress. I think you got lucky for a reason Wheels, you got lucky because i=
t was fate. Yep that's what it was, fate. And from what I kinda know about =
Roddimus... "Grime"... He wasn't too ready ta take on the responsibility of=
 ben' a Prime officer, it just somehow happened. But you, on the other hand=
, you got what it takes. I think you might just be a lost Prime, if ya ask =
me."
> 
> > "Hmph, let's see what Lord Elder thinks. Sir, what'dya think? C=
ould Wheels be the next Autobot leader?"
> 
> Lord Elder frowned as they sp=
oke of Rodimus in derogatory terms,
> listening to the name they called him=
. "A leader, a Prime is special.
> He must prove himself, not only in battl=
e but also in wisdom, and be
> able to rally the Maximals and Autobots." El=
der glanced pointedly at
> Tuscon, "and he must learn to see past what he t=
hinks is the obvious
> answer."
> 
> Elder turned back to his controls as h=
e linked up with the ark's
> systems, "No!" he said as he watched one of hi=
s smaller screens in
> front him, "There is a Minion hovering over the old =
Maximal base"
> Elder glanced at Rat Trap, "The one you used when you first=
 arrived."
> 
> Elder replayed the last set of transmissions:
> 
> > "Marau=
der." Legacy began, his voice carrying the
> > slightest hint of curiousnes=
s. "We are holding no
> > minion prisoner. Whom do you mean?"
> >
> > Marau=
der's voice quickly replied over the same
> > channel, his voice calm and c=
onfident, "The minion
> > known as Lamia, she has called out to me, you wil=
l
> > release her immediately"
> 
> He looked back to his controls, "We may=
 need to change course to assist."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> (Lord Elder)
>=
